DOCNAME: CASE OF SERGEYEV AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Deprivation of property);Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . All the applicants except PERSON and Ms M. Barzakova were at the material time members of the NORP military forces and took part in peace - keeping operations in former GPE . Ms N. ORG and PERSON Barzakova ’s late husbands were also members of the NORP military forces and took part in the same operations .
CARDINAL . All those servicemen sued their respective military units in courts for payment of outstanding DATE allowance allegedly due to them on account of their military missions abroad .

CARDINAL . On various dates the courts allowed the ORG claims and awarded them monetary compensation . The judgements became binding and enforceable but were not enforced by the authorities . The details of the judgments appear in the Appendix below .

CARDINAL . On the dates specified in the Appendix , the Presidium of ORG quashed the judgments by way of supervisory review , considering that the lower courts had erroneously applied the domestic material law . As a result , the applicants’ claims were dismissed .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law governing the supervisory review procedure at the material time is summed up in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of ORG ( see ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALIX ) and Sobelin and Others ( see Sobelin and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL et al . , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE judgments delivered against the public authorities were executed in accordance with a special procedure established , inter alia , by the ORG ’s Decree No . CARDINAL of DATE and , subsequently , by Decree No . CARDINAL of DATE , entrusting execution to ORG ( see further details in PERSON and Others v. GPE , nos . PERSON . , § § DATE , DATE ) .
